description: 100 multiple‑choice questions derived from conceptual content of the TWFD‑OVER Training Guide (excludes exercises and slide option references).

questions.text: What is the primary role of ThingWorx Composer?
options: A database client for SQL schemas
A mobile app for field service only
A web-based modeling environment to define and manage entities
A desktop CAD tool for designing parts

questions.text: Which description best fits a ThingWorx 'Thing'?
options: An entity that models a real or logical asset with properties, services, and events
A static file used for styling mashups

questions.text: What is the relationship between Thing Templates and Things?
options: Templates are only used by Data Tables
Things can be instantiated from Thing Templates to inherit structure and behavior

questions.text: What is the purpose of Thing Shapes?
options: Reusable sets of properties/services that can be composed into templates or things

questions.text: Which artifact typically defines tabular schemas for InfoTables?
What is an InfoTable used for in ThingWorx?
options: A structured in-memory table for passing data (rows defined by a Data Shape)

questions.text: Which entity contains visual UI pages assembled with widgets and data bindings?
Which component enables organization and packaging of related artifacts?
What are Style Definitions used for?
options: Reusable styles to maintain consistent look and feel of widgets

questions.text: Which editor binds data sources to widgets and configures events?
Which statement about Thing properties is correct?
options: Properties represent state and can be persistent or non-persistent

questions.text: What is a service in ThingWorx?
options: Executable server-side function that can be invoked to perform logic
A CSS style for a widget

questions.text: What are events used for?
options: To signal that a notable condition occurred on an entity

questions.text: What do subscriptions do in ThingWorx?
options: Execute logic in response to events on entities

questions.text: Which scripting language is commonly used for server-side services/subscriptions?
Which term describes logic that runs on a schedule without user interaction?
Which mechanism detects changes and triggers handlers on property updates?
Which flag defines whether a property value is saved across restarts?
Which approach helps avoid duplicated code across multiple Things?
options: Define common logic in Thing Templates or Thing Shapes

questions.text: Which item commonly triggers a subscription besides custom events?
options: Property change or data source event

questions.text: When should you mark a property as read-only?
options: To allow mashups to write freely
When multiple users need to edit simultaneously
When the value is derived or managed exclusively by internal logic

questions.text: Which best practice improves service maintainability?
options: Keep services small, testable, and use Data Shapes for typed inputs/outputs

questions.text: What is the purpose of Streams?
options: Append-only time-series storage of event-like records

questions.text: How do Value Streams differ from Streams?
options: Value Streams track property value history for Things

questions.text: What are Data Tables used for?
options: Persist tabular business data with typed columns (via Data Shapes)

questions.text: Which store is best for property history?
Which artifact defines the column schema for Data Tables?
Which term describes non-persistent in-memory tables passed among services?
How can you query a Data Table?
options: Using Thing services that support filters and sorting based on Data Shape

questions.text: What practice improves data typing across services?
options: Use Data Shapes to guarantee columns and types

questions.text: What is the advantage of using Streams for audit-like records?
options: Append-only design simplifies immutable event logging

questions.text: What storage would you choose for stable business lists with lookup columns?
Which persistence decision helps performance for frequently changing properties?
options: Write to Streams for every change
Use non-persistent properties unless history is required

questions.text: How do you return tabular results from a service?
options: Create an InfoTable output typed by a Data Shape

questions.text: What is an Organization used for?
options: Define hierarchical visibility domains for users/groups

questions.text: How are Users and User Groups used?
options: To authenticate and group permissions for entities

questions.text: What is Visibility in ThingWorx?
options: Who can see the entity (scope of discovery)

questions.text: What do Runtime Permissions control?
options: Who can execute services, read properties, or invoke events

questions.text: What do Design-Time Permissions control?
options: Who can create/modify entities and set metadata

questions.text: What is an Application Key?
options: A token granting programmatic access (e.g., REST calls) for a user

questions.text: Which best practice improves security for REST clients?
options: Scope application keys minimally and rotate them

questions.text: What is the effect of visibility on search in Composer?
options: Entities outside your visibility are not discoverable

questions.text: Which permission should restrict who can run a critical service?
Which configuration enables anonymous REST clients safely?
options: Never — require authenticated access or locked-down anon roles

questions.text: What is the recommended way to grant wide read access while limiting writes?
options: Assign group read runtime permissions; restrict service execute

questions.text: Where do you manage user password policies and lockouts?
Which protocol is commonly used by ThingWorx Edge for bi-directional connectivity?
Which interface enables RESTful access to services and properties?
What is a Resource in ThingWorx?
options: A global singleton providing reusable platform functions

questions.text: Which connector type is ideal for industrial OPC data?
How can external systems push data into ThingWorx without a persistent session?
options: Invoke REST endpoints with application keys

questions.text: What is the recommended way to model many similar assets?
options: Use a Thing Template + auto-create Things

questions.text: Which pattern helps normalize varied device payloads?
options: Define Data Shapes and transform to InfoTables

questions.text: Which mechanism executes code upon inbound MQTT/AlwaysOn events?
options: Subscriptions bound to events on Things

questions.text: How do you secure edge connectivity credentials?
options: Provision device-specific keys and rotate regularly

questions.text: What is the benefit of using Resources for utility logic?
options: Centralize shared functions to avoid duplication

questions.text: Which binding type connects widget properties to service outputs?
Which practice improves mashup responsiveness?
options: Limit synchronous service calls and cache static data
Run all services on page load

questions.text: What is a repeater widget typically used for?
options: Render repeating data rows using a template

questions.text: Which approach reduces mashup round-trips?
How do you pass structured results to widgets?
options: Use InfoTables typed by Data Shapes

questions.text: Which widget helps visualize KPI time series?
Which recommendation helps with very large tables?
options: Render thousands of rows at once

questions.text: Which technique styles multiple widgets consistently?
Which event allows reacting to user actions in mashups?
How should you handle long-running logic?
options: Move to async/background services; show progress

questions.text: Which mashup design improves reusability?
Which binding connects a widget property back to a service input?
Which practice ensures predictable updates when models change? (variant 1)
options: Capture design intent and use typed Data Shapes
